column4: Anybody is having problems with the nividia drivers after last update (on edgy)?
It says: (EE) Failed to load module "nvidia" (module does not exist, 0)
we have seen reports of it ont he forums from a very small minority of people... you just need to reinstall nvidia
please follow the guide again, unisntalling and reinstalling your nvidia-glx package
same problem... I have reinstalled nividia-glx, the restricted drivers, and even rebooted
I think it could be a problem with paths and where the xorg tries to load the nvidia_drv... See strace at: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/1809/
I'm sorry but that means nothing to me :)
The problem was I was using xserver-xorg-core version 1.1.99.903-1
oh and you need a new version?
you might have needed to recompile nvidia to get it working...
with new xserver-xorg comes new headers which needs new recompilation of nvidia
yeah we had several people affected a while ago... too many to call it a co-incidence, too little for it to be anything major
maybe only a few people is using edgy-updates
